data.title: Ministry of Balance Reports: Big Small Changes!
data.meta_description: World of Warships: Legends brings iconic ships and greatest commanders to Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4 and 5, iOS, and Android in the ultimate naval action MMO!
data.text:
January 12, 2023

In this short update, we’re making a bunch of changes to gameplay, including revamps for the French destroyer and Italian cruiser Tech Trees.

French Destroyers

First, let's take a look at the changes to French destroyers. In the past, these ships have acted primarily as torpedo destroyers due to a combination of factors like the Go All Out skill, their fast torpedo reload, and their high speed. To make these ships match their ship designs more closely and change their role, we’re transforming them into gunboat destroyers. After all, they were designed to counter less well-armed counterparts.

That said, this change comes in the form of increased charges of Main Battery Reload Booster and improvements to their main battery shells, at the cost of torpedo performance:

Tier IV Premium Siroco, Royal Navy Tier VII Premium Caprice, and German Tier VII Premium ZF-6 have also received the following changes to their Main Battery Reload booster:

• Main Battery Reload Booster charges increased from 1 to 2

• Main Battery Reload Booster cooldown time decreased from 150 to 120 s

This is because these ships share the same Main Battery Reload Booster as the tech tree ships (except Le Fantasque, Mogador, & Kleber), and therefore received the same improvements. This was not intended, but we consider it a happy accident as it should not cause any issues for game balance with these ships.

Italian Tech Tree Cruisers

In this update, the Italian Tech Tree cruisers from Tier II to Tier VII are receiving the option to equip Semi-Armor-Piercing (SAP) shells. You will have the choice of using HE or SAP shells when helming these ships, like with their Premium counterparts and Marco Polo. A few of these ships have also received improvements to their standard AP shells.

In regard to the increase in reload time for SAP shells, the majority of Italian cruisers have been performing well, with the exception of the lower tier ships. The results of testing show that giving SAP shells to a ship markedly increases her performance, so we aim to make this addition without overcooking the ships. If needed, changes can always be made in the future.

HE Penetration Logic

This is a fundamental change to how all high-explosive (HE) munitions work in the game (main battery guns, ATBA guns, carrier bombs).

Before this change, HE of all types had to have greater penetration than the armor the shell (or bomb) struck. So, if an HE shell had 25 mm of penetration, it could only penetrate up to 24 mm of armor. This was called the "Greater Than" or "–1 Rule."

After this change, HE of all types will now penetrate armor that is thinner or equal totheir penetration value. So, if an HE shell has 25 mm of penetration, it can penetrate up to 25 mm of armor. We call this the "Equal To" rule.

In effect, this improves the effectiveness of HE shells and secondary battery guns in the game, the most improved ships will be light cruisers armed with 6-inch (152 mm) guns at Tiers V and VI. We’re aware of a few additional changes that may need to be made and will be watching impacted ships closely—in particular, the battleships at these tiers.

Miscellaneous

VII Vanguard

Finally, let's start the new year with a time-honored tradition—a Vanguard buff! This change makes the ship more consistent with the rest of the British battleship Tech Tree while marginally improving her overall performance.

Main battery HE shell penetration increased from 64 to 95 mm

Try out the changes, and turn the tide!
